resources.string: PharaSnap need access to android accessibility framework to read text on your screen as well as to identify where the text elements are placed on the screen when you tap on them. \nAdditionally required to take screenshot of the screen to capture images for recognizing text on them using image to text recognition (OCR)

Accessibility services helps app read content on the screen in this case accessibility permission is required to read text and images on screen and on other apps. On the settings, select this app and enable accessibility permission

When capturing text there are two modes, 
1) Normal mode where you simply tap on text element on screen to capture (this could be button, label or multiline paragraph). 

2) Image mode uses text recognition OCR (for now only support latin characters) to capture text on images. 

You can toggle between the two modes on left-most button on the widget.
